{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rheumatic heart disease is a condition that occurs as a complication of rheumatic fever. It is characterized by inflammation and damage to the heart valves. The major criteria for diagnosing rheumatic heart disease include arthritis, carditis, subcutaneous nodules, and a raised ASLO (anti-streptolysin O) titer. Therefore, the answer choice that is NOT a major criteria for Rheumatic heart disease is D. Raised ASLO titer.", "answer_choice": "D"}
